definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

sentences.english: Lily: Pass me the marker, please.

sentences.chinese: 我喜欢这支红色的记号笔。

sentences.english: Complete and get the big marker out to cross them off the list.
sentences.chinese: 完成这些，然后用记号笔将它们从清单中醒目地划掉。

sentences.english: Use a yellow marker for new words.
sentences.chinese: 如遇到生词请用记号笔标出。

sentences.english: He or she will give you and your partner a balloon and a permanent marker.
sentences.chinese: 他会给你和你的助手一个气球和一个记号笔。

sentences.english: The next step was to get a big red magic marker.
sentences.chinese: 下一步是弄一支大红色记号笔。

sentences.english: Who's the girl with the magic markers up there?
sentences.chinese: 上边那个拿着记号笔的女孩呢？

sentences.english: You can use a black permanent marker and acrylic paints to draw faces on the milk jugs, too.
sentences.chinese: 你还可以用黑色记号笔和油漆在罐子表面画上图案。

sentences.english: Put the marker in the pencil cottom.

definition: felt-tip pen/roller ball pen/gel ink pen
